question.title: Workaround for jooq multiset query with custom type and DataTypeException
question.body:
The project uses PostgreSQl, and a complex type. DDL is like:

CREATE TYPE attached_file AS (
    id int8,
    file_name varchar(255),
    file_size int8,
    bucket bucket_type);
  1. There is a complex expression, that involves a table with the custom type
  2. There is a big query, that uses the complex expression inside a multiset() call

In some cases I get a DataTypeException, that states like 1234 (BigDecimal) cannot be converted to Bucket.class

org.jooq.impl.JSONReader Line 312

                if (value instanceof List)
                    l = patchRecord(ctx, multiset, actualRow, (List<Object>) value);
                else if (value instanceof Map)
                    l = patchRecord(ctx, multiset, actualRow, new ArrayList<>(((Map<?, ?>) value).values()));
                else
                    throw new IllegalStateException();

By debugging, the contents of actualRow parameter and value has an order mismatch. Value is a map, actually a LinkedHashMap, and is not in the same order as the fields expected in actualRow parameter, the patchRecord call returns a List of Objects in the wrong order, and tries to convert the file_size field's value to Bucket (which is an enum).

This looks like a bug in jooq, hard to reproduce, or create a testcase that exactly reproduces it. Looking the code, I think the patchRecord call should respect the map, and pair fields to map items by key, instead of calling the values() on the map.

At first, I am looking for a workaround to this issue.

I am trying to swap to another multiset emulation mode, or switch to multiset_agg. (didn't worked)

row(
  LOAD_BOOKING_INFO.fkBookedBy(),
  LOAD_BOOKING_INFO.fkBookedBy().portalUser(),
  LOAD_BOOKING_INFO.fkBookedBy().disposalFacilityAccessCode(),
  LOAD_BOOKING_INFO.fkBookedBy().disposalFacilityContact(),
  LOAD_BOOKING_INFO.fkBookedBy().companyAccessCode().company()
).convertFrom(mapping(AuthLoginDto::new))

replaced to

row(
     AUTH_LOGIN.asTable(),
     AUTH_LOGIN.portalUser(),
     AUTH_LOGIN.disposalFacilityAccessCode(),
     AUTH_LOGIN.disposalFacilityContact(),
     COMPANY_ACCESS_CODE.company()
).convertFrom(mapping(AuthLoginDto::new)).as(BOOKED_BY)

the complex type is a field for company table, so it is still has an implicit join reference, only the way there has been changed

question_comments.body: I'll be happy to look at a minimal reproducer.
I have swapped some implicit joins to explicit left joins, and it looks like working now.
I can't share the full query, as it's confidential, and also big. Separated to several methods that collects pieces of it, so I gave description of general context.

Can you please show your jOOQ query? Rather than attempting to analyse a potential bug, a minimal reproducer is much more helpful. See stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example for a rationale, or in jOOQ's case, a template to create reproducers: github.com/jOOQ/jOOQ-mcve
